body.name: Everyone in My Family Has Killed Someone: A Novel
body.description: Knives Out and Clue meet Agatha Christie and The Thursday Murder Club in this “utterly original” (Jane Harper), “not to be missed” (Karin Slaughter), fiendishly clever blend of classic and modern murder mystery.“A witty twist on classic whodunits… Stevenson not only 'plays fair,' he plays the mystery game very, very well.”—Maureen Corrigan, Washington PostEveryone in my family has killed someone. Some of us, the high achievers, have killed more than once. I’m not trying to be dramatic, but it is the truth. Some of us are good, others are bad, and some just unfortunate.I’m Ernest Cunningham. Call me Ern or Ernie. I wish I’d killed whoever decided our family reunion should be at a ski resort, but it’s a little more complicated than that.Have I killed someone? Yes. I have.Who was it?Let’s get started.EVERYONE IN MY FAMILY HAS KILLED SOMEONEMy brotherMy stepsisterMy wifeMy fatherMy motherMy sister-in-lawMy uncleMy stepfatherMy auntMe Read more

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #799 in Audible Books & Originals (See Top 100 in Audible Books & Originals) #2 in Dark Humor #2 in Dark Humor Literature & Fiction #4 in Amateur Sleuth Mysteries (Audible Books & Originals)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Such a fun mystery
reviews.reviewText: I loved the style of this book! It story kept me on my toes and I couldn’t get to the reveal fast enough! It has a great twist!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Slow to start, but a good ending
reviews.reviewText: This book has a lot of good- It does feel very knives out, It's not the darkest or scariest thriller, and it had an interesting narrator. Overall I enjoyed this bookThe issues I had are as follows; This book was confusing - maybe this was just a problem specific to me but some of the details and the way it was written made this hard to follow at times. The characters were challenging to keep track of, partly because there were so many, and partly because so many weren't of great importance. It was slow to start, I wasn't fully absorbed and committed until around the halfway point.Like I said at the beginning, the book was good overall, and I may read the next book that this author puts out.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good idea for a plot but too complicated
reviews.reviewText: While I liked the character of the narrator - funny and smart, but aware of his own limitations - the plot was just too complicated and convoluted. It didn't help that the major plot point, about which the entire book revolves, wasn't resolved until the last few paragraphs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A killer narrator
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoyed this book. A fun mystery with all kinds of twists and turns. Our lead character is witty and clever enough to be a likable protagonist but not necessarily smart enough to solve the mystery in the first five minutes. I also like how he keeps reminding the reader that it’s too early to have revealed who the killer is. Speaking of which the reveal is good and slightly unexpected. I think you’ll have a fun time figuring out which of these killers is the killer. 5/5

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Quirky and twisty with a clever setup and a great "voice"
reviews.reviewText: 4.5 stars - I loved it!Wow. This was stunning. Quirky and twisty with a clever setup and a great "voice" for the narrator who is super self-aware. I didn't want to put this one down. I would have given this five stars, but the other characters were hard to like. Looking forward to book 2 already! (Language)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quirky fun read
reviews.reviewText: Lots of twist and turns presented in a unique narrative form. Highly recommend to anyone who likes a locked room mystery

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars True to the title.
reviews.reviewText: Thought it sounded intriguing. Interesting and well written. I liked it , read it but thought it could have been more captivating.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars A who-dun-it, part mystery, part comedy
reviews.reviewText: "Everyone in my family has killed someone. Some of us, the high achievers, have killed more than once."The title of this book certainly got my attention. Knowing nothing except the title, I dove in expecting a great murder mystery or, at least, a humorous one. In the end it was a little of both.The story is set at a ski resort in Australia during a severe snow storm where the Cunningham family is holding their family reunion. Although each person has his or her secrets, most of the family is aware of the dirty backgrounds of the relatives. The story is told in the first person by Ernest Cunningham who is himself an author, his specialty is in writing books on “how to write books”. He also serves as a self-appointed family historian as he sets the stage for the story and explains each of the characters and their many foibles. There were many asides in the story when Ernest speaks directly to the reader, often adding more confusion. Finally, Ernest is also the Sleuth of the story.Unfortunately the book moved fairly slowly and was overly complicated due to the sheer number of family members, plus non-family characters, that the reader needed to keep track of. The story offers a unique take on a murder mystery, unfortunately, the plot and back stories were excessively complicated which, at times, made the story more confusing than fun. ⭐️⭐️⭐️
Completely different style of telling a story. The story itself is very good. Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Really enjoyed how this book was written, I’ve a feeling I could be friends with Benjamin (Author) as he has a great sense of humour.
It is a fun read, nothing too sophisticated, easy bed-time literature with an engaging storyline and catchy narrative.
Interesting choice for the narrator to talk to the reader but I have to admit I got bored half way through. Think 'S inspector fall's in a mountain resort. Entertaining nonetheless.

reviews.reviewTitle: Delivery in proper time and condition
reviews.reviewText: The page quality is not that good. Otherwise Amazon delivery including the speed of delivery was quite good.
